alert.note: Alert for Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Jefferson; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wakulla, southeastern Liberty, west central Jefferson and southeastern Leon Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Tallahassee Community College to 17 miles north of Carrabelle. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Woodville, St. Marks, Crawfordville, Wakulla, Sopchoppy, Lake Bradford, Cody, Shadeville, Leon Sinks, Gaither Community Center, Wakulla Springs, Walker Ford Community Center, South City, Eight Mile Pond, Panacea, Poplar Camp, Medart, Bethel and Tallahassee Regional A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Jefferson; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty
